usefulItems: bowl, stock pot (3-4 L), stock pot (8L), 1 plate, paper towel, large bowl, aluminium foil, Roasting rack, deep-sided roasting tray (32 x 23 cm), serving platter, wooden skewer, stove top, refrigerator, oven
title: Turkey buffe and herby quinoa stuffing

ingredients.content: 3000 g water, plus extra if needed
3400 - 4000 g turkey buffe, frame only, wings and legs removed
850 g water, plus extra for soaking quinoa
½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
6 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
100 g dried cranberries, plus extra for garnishing
12 fresh chives, cut into small pieces (2 mm)

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh salt and sugar into it. Transfer into a pot large enough to contain turkey (ensure pot can fit into your refrigerator). Add water, juniper berries, black peppercorns, cinnamon and bay leaves to pot. Place pot over high heat for 3-5 minutes, until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Once cooled, submerge turkey, topping up with cold water to cover if necessary. Place a plate on top of turkey to keep submerged under water and transfer into refrigerator for 2 hours.

Remove turkey from brine, rinse well inside and out, then transfer onto a plate. Pat dry with paper towel and transfer into refrigerator, uncovered, for a minimum of 2 hours (up to 24 hours) to completely dry out.
Cut butter into thin pieces and carefully place under the breast skin of the bird, pulling the skin away from the meat, gently but firmly. Stand, uncovered, and bring to room temperature.

Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh quinoa into it. Rest simmering basket in a large bowl. Cover quinoa with water and allow to soak for 5 minutes. Rinse under running water until water runs clear.

Place 600 g of the water and a pinch of extra salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with quinoa into mixing bowl and cook <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set quinoa aside (quinoa will not be completely cooked). Discard water, then rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place onion, garlic, basil, parsley, thyme, dill, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add reserved quinoa, cranberries, half of the chives and 40 g of the butter and combine <b>10 sec//speed 3<b>. Adjust seasoning, if desired.

Preheat oven to 180°C. Stuff brined turkey with quinoa mixture. Place turkey into a deep-sided roasting dish (32 x 23 cm) on a roasting rack, breast side down, placing remaining 250 g water in the bottom of the tray. Gently place a sheet of aluminium foil over exposed quinoa in turkey cavity. Transfer any remaining quinoa mixture around turkey and cook for 45 minutes (180°C).

Rotate turkey to breast side up. Baste breasts with remaining 40 g butter. Add extra water to bottom of roasting dish if needed and bake for 45-60 minutes (180°C), until turkey is cooked, checking water levels every 20 minutes. To check turkey is cooked, pierce the thickest part of the breast with a skewer; turkey is fully cooked when juices run clear. Remove from oven and allow to rest for 10-15 minutes, loosely covered with aluminium foil. Slice turkey, garnish with remaining chives and extra cranberries, and serve with quinoa from roasting dish.
